<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Gladiator Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1976) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 175 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Gladiator](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=61)

**Prerequisites**
[Impressive Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=793)

</column>

---

You know how to turn combat into a form of entertainment. You become trained in [Gladiatorial Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8); if already trained in Gladiatorial Lore, you instead become trained in another Lore skill of your choice. 

At the start of a combat encounter, if you have spectators, you gain a number of temporary HP equal to your character level for 1 minute and you can roll [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) for your initiative.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the gladiator archetype.

<title level="2">Gladiator Dedication leads to...</title>
[Big Debut](/Feats.aspx?ID=4146), [Fancy Moves](/Feats.aspx?ID=1977), [Living for the Applause](/Feats.aspx?ID=4142), [Performative Weapons Training](/Feats.aspx?ID=1980), [Play to the Crowd](/Feats.aspx?ID=1978), [Stage Fighting](/Feats.aspx?ID=1979)
name: Gladiator Dedication
